abstract: Egypt's Foreign Ministry objects to British ambassador John Casson's criticism of its court ruling sentencing Al Jazeera journalists Mohamed Fahmy and Baher Mohamed to three years in prison each; men, both respected journalists, were charged with attempting to destabilize country through false reports.
lead_paragraph: John Casson, who was in the courtroom when two journalists were sentenced to prison, said the move would damage confidence in the rule of law in Egypt.

headline.main: Egypt Defends Ruling Against Two Al Jazeera Journalists
headline.print_headline: Egypt Defends Ruling Against Two Journalists

snippet: John Casson, who was in the courtroom when two journalists were sentenced to prison, said the move would damage confidence in the rule of law in Egypt.
